nodes.title: Description
nodes.body: Bodhicitta ("the mind of enlightenment") is the intention to attain enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings. Bodhicitta is considered to be the central motivation for religious practice in the Mahāyāna. While bodhicitta may be practiced as a form of meditation, it can also be generated ritualistically in front of a master or a visualized deity. Such a ritual procedure serves to implant the seeds within the disciple for the further cultivation of bodhicitta. The ritualistic generation of bodhicitta is part of many sutra and tantric rituals, like the taking of bodhisattva vows, and tantric initiation. However, bodhicitta generation rituals are sometimes stand-alone rites. The present Dalai Lama often enacts these rituals independent of any others.

nodes.title: Example Texts
nodes.body:
• byang chub sems bskyed pa'i cho ga shin tu rgyas pa
  • byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i cho ga
  • byang chub sems bskyed pa'i 'bogs chog

nodes.title: Secondary Sources
nodes.body: Chris: Look at Jeffrey's book on the Kalacakra initiation to see if there is a section on the generation of bodhicitta in a ritualistic fashion.
